summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a telephonic interview with an unnamed witness on February 26, 2021. The witness discusses associations with Eva Dubin, knowledge of people connected to Jeffrey Epstein, and hearsay about a potential trafficking network and disturbing ritualistic claims involving an unnamed multimillionaire. The witness was reluctant to share names over the phone and a follow-up virtual interview was scheduled.

persons.name: Eva Dubin
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the witness has been around and worked with in the same industry. The witness sent a photograph identifying her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation. The witness claims to have pictures of people directly associated with him.

persons.name: Glen Dubin
persons.context: Mentioned as the husband of Eva Dubin. A young lady who was an au pair for the Dubins reported being held against her wishes.

connections.description: Referred to as "the DUBINs," indicating they are a married couple who employed an au pair.
The witness has pictures of people directly associated with Epstein, and Eva Dubin is among the individuals the witness knows.

events.title: FBI Telephonic Interview with Witness
events.description: An unnamed witness was interviewed telephonically by the FBI. The witness provided information about associations with the Dubins, knowledge of Epstein associates, and hearsay about trafficking and ritualistic abuse.

events.title: Scheduled Virtual FBI Interview
events.description: A follow-up virtual interview with the witness was coordinated for this date after the witness expressed discomfort sharing names over the phone.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A witness claims to have pictures of people directly associated with Jeffrey Epstein, though not of crimes being committed.
The witness heard from a young au pair for Glen and Eva Dubin who claimed she was being held against her wishes, though the witness did not believe it at the time.

The witness advised there were 'key players' involved in trafficking from Switzerland and knew of a multimillionaire 'key player' who claimed to be part of a group that 'drinks the blood of children.'
The witness was reluctant to share specific names during the telephonic interview, citing discomfort, leading to the scheduling of a virtual follow-up.
The document is an official FBI 302 report, indicating this information was formally collected as part of the Epstein investigation.
